turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Murphy to Epps.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Epps.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: You just shoot at something?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Yeah. Just a bird. Just a stupid bird.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Just before I heard him yell there was somebody on the radio.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Greer?

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: I don't know. No. Not Greer. Somebody.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: He needs a doctor.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: I'll call us in. Dodge, see how many signal flares you can scrounge up.  Keep an eye on him.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: How's he doing?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Same. Any luck?

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: No. I'll try again later.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: They're dead in the water that morning. Four hours later the captain's relieved of his command. And that evening they issue a general SOS.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Possibly false. Hence the IMA record of being lost at sea. I don't think mutiny's out of the question here.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: You're saying they mutinied for the gold?

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: If they were close enough to shore, they probably figured they could get away in the lifeboats.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Only something must've gone wrong.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: The ah... the radio's out.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Somebody took it out of commission last night.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Smashed it up pretty bad.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: But, who -- ?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: "The crew have gone mad with greed and fight among themselves like wild dogs over fresh kill."

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: February first.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: The same day she supposedly went down.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Must not've been the captain's entry. He was probably out of the picture by then.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: "Their lacking diligence has undoubtedly caused the collision. Distress calls have been made."

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Collision? With what?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: The page's missing. Then their SOS was real.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: But where's the damage?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Maybe the other ship took the worst of it.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: If it was a ship she hit.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: It's a good bet they'll be asking a lot of questions when they get here too.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Let 'em ask. This ship's legally ours now.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: It's not gonna hold us.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Doesn't matter.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Hey.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Hey.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Couldn't sleep.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Wish I could say the same.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: What do you think happened on this boat?

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: I guess that's the sixty four thousand dollar question, isn't it?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: The what?

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Never mind. Before your time.  I think at least some of the crew went a little nuts. The usual stuff that happens when people stumble on a fortune. Equal parts greed and paranoia, usually resulting in homicide. What happened after that is anybody's guess. But, judging by our Greek friends down below, it doesn't look like the last time.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Are we smart enough to avoid that?

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: I don't know, are we?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: When you found me yesterday, at the pool. I'd seen... something.  Someone.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Not our mystery guest again.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: No. Someone else. A girl.  I'm not sure she was... real.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: What, like some kind of ghost?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: I don't know what else you'd call her. One second she was there, the next she was gone.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Maybe hallucination is the wrong word. It was more than that. As though they were showing me.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Showing you what?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: What happened.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Maybe it was one of them did the handy work on those Greeks.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: No. I think they are, were, just passengers. Innocent victims.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Victims of what?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Something bad happened here, Murphy.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: That much I think we've already established.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: More than just a mutiny. More than just the gold.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: She said the ship was evil. That we had to leave right away. That if we didn't, we might never leave.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: What's that supposed to mean?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Why you? How come the rest of us haven't seen these people?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Just lucky I guess.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Murphy to Epps.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Epps, over.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Either of you seen Dodge?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Nope.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: He's not on deck and I can't raise him on the radio.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Epps? You there?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Right here.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: What do we do with him?

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Leave him till we can get some help.  From now on, nobody comes down here.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: What do you think?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Could be a stroke. Who knows?  The general log said the crew were fighting among themselves. "Like wild dogs."

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Over the gold.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Maybe it was more than that.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: They went crazy.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Crazy with greed. Not crazy. Not like him.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Hard to say which is worse, staying here or taking our chances in open water.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: If the weather holds it might not be so bad.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: It's not the weather I'm worried about. The wrong current could drag us as far as the Aleutians before we come across another boat.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: What happened?

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: We hit land.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: We're in an island chain. It's only a matter of time before we hit another one.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Greer's gone. He broke out of the tank.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: You killed them.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: It was only a matter of time before somebody killed somebody.  You saw it coming as well as I did. Dodge had his plans, starting with scuttling the boat. And Greer too, except he went nuts. Couldn't take it, I guess. Could've happened in the middle of downtown Anchorage. But did it make him any less dangerous? I don't think so.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: So you killed them?

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: The way I figure it, it was them or me. I thought putting Dodge up on that pipe was a nice touch? Bought a little time. Made it look like whoever killed those Greeks was still around. But it's just us on this ship. Us and your... spirit friends.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: And now you're gonna kill me, is that it?

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: I didn't want it to turn out this way.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Murphy, don't you see what's happening?

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: I think I see it pretty well.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: It's the ship. The ship's making you think this way.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: I know a little bit about human nature and what I've seen only confirms that.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: It's a trap. There was no way we were gonna get away with that gold. Nobody ever does. It's just the bait. This ship sucks people in and it never lets them out.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: I think maybe you been on this boat a little too long, with all that supernatural mumbo jumbo. There's nothing supernatural about greed. And that's what it comes down to, pure and simple.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: I don't give a damn about the gold.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: I wish I could believe that. Either way, you know what I've done. I've got no choice.

turns.speaker: GREER
turns.text: Greer to Murphy.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Go.

turns.speaker: GREER
turns.text: The number nine on the starboard side's half flooded. Epps says it's a slow leak just under the waterline, about twenty gallons an hour. They must've pumped it before we left Sitka.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Of course they did.

turns.speaker: GREER
turns.text: Let the buyer beware.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: What do you say, Dodge?

turns.speaker: GREER
turns.text: Not bad for dragging a leaky tub half way to Russia.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: He'll sell the scrap for three times what he paid.

turns.speaker: GREER
turns.text: I must be in the wrong business.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: You got that right.

turns.speaker: GREER
turns.text: Better than "making hamburger for Mickey D."

turns.speaker: GREER
turns.text: Red sky at night, sailor's delight.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Red sky in morning, sailor take warning.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: GREER
turns.text: There's a large vessel out about ten miles to the north-west.

turns.speaker: GREER
turns.text: I been watching it for close to an hour and it hasn't moved. I can't raise it on the radio either. Makes me think it might be in trouble.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Alright. I'll be right up.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Too deep to anchor out there.

turns.speaker: GREER
turns.text: Looks like it's adrift.

turns.speaker: GREER
turns.text: Call the Coastguard?

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Steer to one eight five. Let's check her out.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: It's funny.

turns.speaker: GREER
turns.text: How's that?

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Besides a little rust, everything's pretty well-preserved.

turns.speaker: GREER
turns.text: Murphy, goddamit.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Sorry.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Whatever the reason, she's adrift and abandoned. We've got every right to salvage her.

turns.speaker: GREER
turns.text: You mean tow her back? That's a thirty thousand ton ship you're talking about.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: We've done it before.

turns.speaker: GREER
turns.text: All we got to do is hit some rough weather and you can forget about it.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: So we cut her loose and wait it out. A little weather couldn't be anything she hasn't seen before.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Some classy tub in it's day, huh?

turns.speaker: GREER
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Morning.

turns.speaker: GREER
turns.text: You're up late.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Guess I must've fallen back to sleep. Where's Epps?

turns.speaker: GREER
turns.text: How much you figure that's worth, skipper?

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Hard to say. Maybe forty, fifty million.

turns.speaker: GREER
turns.text: Ho, baby!

turns.speaker: GREER
turns.text: If they thought it was lost at sea, they probably just wrote it off.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Not for fifty million. An ocean liner maybe. But fifty million in gold, they come looking for.

turns.speaker: GREER
turns.text: So what? We gonna unload the gold and get a move on?

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: We leave it where it is. Stick to the plan.

turns.speaker: GREER
turns.text: Yeah, but we still gotta haul that big piece of shit all the way back to Sitka.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: It's worth the effort. Believe me. Besides we're gonna need her to prove the salvage.

turns.speaker: GREER
turns.text: I heard that.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Dodge, you gotta get on those repairs.

turns.speaker: GREER
turns.text: What now?

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: We could call for help.

turns.speaker: GREER
turns.text: And get a bunch of fools sniffin' around here?

turns.speaker: GREER
turns.text: Fifty million four ways. That's twelve million and change a piece.  What you gonna do with your share, skipper?

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Not much at all, I guess. Retire. Live out my golden years and all that.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Greer?

turns.speaker: GREER
turns.text: Moving to Sweden.

turns.speaker: GREER
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Let's just take it easy here, alright? Nobody's gonna kill anybody.

turns.speaker: GREER
turns.text: Supposing he wants to get bad with us?

turns.speaker: GREER
turns.text: I say we off-load some of that gold now.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Would you hold on just a minute here, please? Look, there's no reason to panic now. Epps saw somebody. Fine. It's a big boat.  Chances're real good he doesn't even know about the gold. If we stay cool, nobody'll be the wiser.  The gold stays where it is til we're ready to go. Like I said, it'll be a hell of a lot safer there than here.

turns.speaker: GREER
turns.text: Pretty low all around.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: We'll have to take it easy then. I don't think we'll find much aboard the ship, but it's probably worth looking around.

turns.speaker: GREER
turns.text: Ho-ly shit.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Couldn't have happened much more than a month ago.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Greek citizen. Merchant navy.  Obviously we aren't the first to come across this ship. They probably stumbled across it just like we did.

turns.speaker: GREER
turns.text: And look what happened.

turns.speaker: GREER
turns.text: Maybe Epps's mystery man had something to do with it.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Maybe.

turns.speaker: GREER
turns.text: Never been more thirsty in my life.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Drink up then.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: How're you feeling?

turns.speaker: GREER
turns.text: Lost my sea legs.

turns.speaker: GREER
turns.text: What happened?

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: You don't remember?

turns.speaker: GREER
turns.text: Last thing I remember I was aboard the Chimera. Down somewhere in there scavenging around.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: You've been out for about a day.

turns.speaker: GREER
turns.text: Say what?

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Dodge found you out cold in one of the cabins.

turns.speaker: GREER
turns.text: Oh, man.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: We heard you scream. Any idea what you might've seen?

turns.speaker: GREER
turns.text: I wish I could tell you. I'd be real interested to know myself.

turns.speaker: GREER
turns.text: We're not gonna be able to pump it!

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Alright. Everybody grab your gear! This' is where we get off!

turns.speaker: GREER
turns.text: We ain't exactly in what you'd call your high traffic neighborhood either.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: The coast guard has our last position. They'll send somebody out soon enough. A ship this size you can't exactly miss.

turns.speaker: GREER
turns.text: Gettin' a little hot under the collar, I'd say.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Shut up.

turns.speaker: GREER
turns.text: Must be a little too the truth, eh Dodge?

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: It's a Noaa buoy.

turns.speaker: GREER
turns.text: A what?

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Government weather. It's got a transmitter aboard.

turns.speaker: GREER
turns.text: We're still drifting.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: The mooring hasn't come taught.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: He took the shotgun and a light.

turns.speaker: GREER
turns.text: Must've heard something below deck and went down to check it out.

turns.speaker: GREER
turns.text: Can't find the shotgun.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: So whoever did this now has our shotgun.

turns.speaker: GREER
turns.text: Doesn't look like it much matters.

turns.speaker: GREER
turns.text: What about the gold?

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Leave it.

turns.speaker: GREER
turns.text: Now hold up just a minute. Let's be reasonable here.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: You think whoever did this is reasonable?

turns.speaker: GREER
turns.text: All I'm saying is that gold's worth a lot more to us now than it ever was.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Nobody's going anywhere with that gold now. Anybody tries to board, we'll know about it.  You can do what you want, Greer. But neither of us is gonna risk saving your ass down here if it comes to that.

turns.speaker: GREER
turns.text: Fine with me.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: What seems to be the trouble, ladies?

turns.speaker: RIVETER
turns.text: Whyn't you mind your own business, chief.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: As I said, what seems to be the trouble?

turns.speaker: RIVETER
turns.text: Didn't you hear me, grandpa? Or you got your hearing aid turned down?

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: I heard you. But I'm choosing to ignore you. Epps, let's go.

turns.speaker: RIVETER
turns.text: These ladies was having themselves a discussion and you're interrupting it.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: You got about two seconds to get your paws off me, Tarzan.

turns.speaker: RIVETER
turns.text: Or what?

turns.speaker: VASILI
turns.text: I thought you say Tuesday.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Better late than never.

turns.speaker: VASILI
turns.text: What's this?

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: You got a leak in the number nine compartment.

turns.speaker: VASILI
turns.text: No, no. You got leak.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: You pump it out and re-seam the hull, she'll be good as new.

turns.speaker: VASILI
turns.text: That cost me twenty grand at least.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Fifteen, at the most.

turns.speaker: VASILI
turns.text: Twenty. You knock off twenty and then we see. After my guy looks at it.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: You're kidding, right?

turns.speaker: VASILI
turns.text: You want fair pay, make hamburger for Mickey D. Otherwise, please to sign.

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: Have you seen my blue spatula?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Nope. What are you making, pancakes?

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: Not if I don't find that goddamn spatula.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Will you get off my back for once?

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: It's tough to find a good job without any kind of training.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Look, I told you I'm not going to college.

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: Well, I think it's good to keep all your options open. You can always enroll for the winter quarter.  You could even live here and go to the city college part time, and still get a job if you wanted to.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Look at me -- I'm not even listening to a word you're saying.

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: Did I tell you who I ran into at the bagel place?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: Guess.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: How should I know?

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: Someone from the past.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: Give up?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: YES.

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: Maxine.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Not the Maxine?

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: Yup.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: God, how horrifying.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Hi.  Look, I'm kind of tired - I think I'll go to bed.

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: I made spaghetti. Do you want some?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: I-I really have to get up early for class tomorrow.

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: I have some good news for you, Pumpkin.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: What is it now?

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: Are you still looking for a job?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: I guess.

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: Well, Maxine thinks she can get you a sales job at Computer Station. Normally you have to have references and at least two years of experience, but she thinks she can convince them.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Tell her to forget it - I don't need her help.

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: Pumpkin? What's wrong?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Nothing.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: It's nothing -- it's just some hormonal thing... don't worry about it...

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: I've got some important news to tell you, but it can wait till later if you're not feeling...

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: Well... as you know, Maxine and I have been seeing a lot of each other, and we decided it might be a good idea for all of us if she came back here to live at the end of the Summer, just so we can all get to know each other and to make sure this is what we want.

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: Pumpkin, are you in there?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Are you going to yell at me?

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: About what?

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: Yeah, I heard about that.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: I was in a horrible mood - tell her not to worry, I'll be completely out of her life in a few days.

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: She understands what you're going through and she really wants to help you. She says that job at Computer Station is still available if you want it.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: I-I'm not sure... yeah, maybe.

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: Actually, I was just checking to see if you were here - your friend Seymour is on his way up.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: What do you mean "on his way up"!?

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: I just buzzed him in.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: What's wrong with you?! Tell him I'm not here!

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: But I can't --

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: JUST DO IT!

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: That was great - jeez, thanks again for cooking all this.

turns.speaker: DANA
turns.text: Oh I love to cook. I guess most women wouldn't invite a man over on the first date, but I believe you should trust your instincts. When I talked to you on the phone you just seemed so... I don't know... harmless. Ready for ice cream?

turns.speaker: DANA
turns.text: Here we are... it's mocha mint from Lickety Splits. Oh, isn't that photograph just heart-rending?

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: Yeah ... where is this? Bosnia?

turns.speaker: DANA
turns.text: Was it Bosnia? I forget...  It's so sad, the tragedy of an entire country eloquently captured in the face of one little boy.  A Soul/Funk song starts up on the radio that catches her attention. She goes over and turns it up.

turns.speaker: DANA
turns.text: Oh, I just love this song! Isn't it great? Doesn't it make you want to dance? C'mon!

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: Uh, well, that's okay - I don't dance, heh, heh...

turns.speaker: DANA
turns.text: Don't be silly, anyone can dance. Here, just follow me... watch my feet.

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: No, really I --

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: Hey, it's nearly nine already - we're gonna have to leave now if we're going to make that movie.

turns.speaker: DANA
turns.text: Oh, all right... Party-pooper! Just let me put a few things away.

turns.speaker: DANA
turns.text: I'm so excited to see this film - Dustoffvarnya is such a brilliant director! Did you see his last film, The Flower That Drank The Moon? It was simply glorious!

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: Uh, no. I missed that one. But what do I know? I like Laurel and Hardy movies.

turns.speaker: DANA
turns.text: Really? I never really cared for those. Why does the fat one always have to be so mean to the skinny one?

turns.speaker: DANA
turns.text: Seymour?... uh... hello... I guess I'm a little early...

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: Dana! Hi!  Uh, Dana... this is Enid...

turns.speaker: DANA
turns.text: Hello...

turns.speaker: DANA
turns.text: Seymour! Hello! What are you doing here?

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: Oh -- please - don't let me interrupt finish your phone call.

turns.speaker: DANA
turns.text: We're almost done.  Hi. Yeah... no, it's excluded. They've already paid the earnest money... well, let them bring it up if they notice it at the final walk through. Right, great, sounds good!

turns.speaker: DANA
turns.text: Hey... so, what brings you down here?

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: I uh... I feel that I need to uh -- there's something I feel I have to say... I uh, I've never said this to anyone before -- believe me, I've stayed in horrible relationships for years just so I wouldn't have to do this, but I uh...

turns.speaker: DANA
turns.text: What are you trying to say?

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: It's just that I feel like it's maybe not a good idea for us to keep going out.

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: I-I honestly never intended for this to happen...

turns.speaker: DANA
turns.text: Please tell me it isn't that teenager!

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: Enid and I were just friends. You know... we feel comfortable around each other... she really likes my old records and...

turns.speaker: DANA
turns.text: I can't believe this! I thought at the very least a guy like you would never pull this kind of shit on me!

turns.speaker: ROBERTA
turns.text: And what can you tell us about this...

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Enid. It's sort of like a diary I guess.

turns.speaker: ROBERTA
turns.text: Who is this, Enid?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: It's supposed to be Don Knotts.

turns.speaker: ROBERTA
turns.text: And what was your reason for choosing him as your subject?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: I dunno... I just like Don Knotts.

turns.speaker: ROBERTA
turns.text: I see... interesting...

turns.speaker: ROBERTA
turns.text: These are all valid comments, but I think we should see if the artist has anything to bring to this.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Well, I got the idea when I was doing some research and I discovered that Cook's Chicken used to be called Coon's Chicken, and so I decided to do my project based on this discovery as kind of a comment on racism... and the way racism is whitewashed over in our culture...

turns.speaker: ROBERTA
turns.text: Did you actually do this painting?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Well, no - it's more like a "found art object."

turns.speaker: ROBERTA
turns.text: And how do you think this addresses the subject of racism?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: It's complicated... I guess I'm trying to show how racism used to -- more out in the open and now it's hidden, or something...

turns.speaker: ROBERTA
turns.text: And how does an image like this help us to see that?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: I'm not sure... I mean...  I guess because when we see something like this it seems really shocking and we have to figure out why it's so shocking?

turns.speaker: ROBERTA
turns.text: Enid, can I talk to you for a minute?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Uh-oh.

turns.speaker: ROBERTA
turns.text: Don't worry - it's nothing bad. I was just wondering what your plans were for next year?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: I'm not really sure - working, I guess...

turns.speaker: ROBERTA
turns.text: Well, I know this is really short notice, but I got a call from a very close friend at the Academy of Art & Design and she tells me that I'm allowed to place one student from your graduating class in a one year scholarship program... and, well, I hope you don't mind, Enid, but I took the liberty of submitting your name.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Hmm.

turns.speaker: ROBERTA
turns.text: As far as I know it includes housing and meals and everything... it is really quite an offer...

turns.speaker: ROBERTA
turns.text: So what do you think?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: I dunno... Would I have to take classes and stuff?

turns.speaker: ROBERTA
turns.text: Well, yes...

turns.speaker: ROBERTA
turns.text: Let me know as soon as you can, Enid. This could be a great thing for you.

turns.speaker: ROBERTA
turns.text: Enid! I'm so sorry about what happened.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: ROBERTA
turns.text: The whole business with the art show and the newspaper -- it's absolutely --

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Huh?

turns.speaker: ROBERTA
turns.text: Didn't Principal Jaffee call you?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: I didn't check my messages...

turns.speaker: ROBERTA
turns.text: Oh my goodness... well, the whole thing is just ridiculous, and as soon as the school board is back in session next Fall I'm going to do everything I can to help you.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Help me what?

turns.speaker: ROBERTA
turns.text: Well they're forcing me to give you a non-passing grade in the class because of what happened at the exhibition... but don't worry -- I'm sure I'll be able to get you your diploma in the Fall!

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: But... can I still get that scholarship to the Art Academy?

turns.speaker: ROBERTA
turns.text: I'm sorry, Enid - you have to be an official high school graduate before I can nominate you.  I had to give it to someone else...  But I'm sure next year I can --

turns.speaker: MANAGER
turns.text: I'm gonna let you handle the four thirty crowd by yourself - that way I can evaluate your performance while it's slow and ease you into the bigger crowds.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: You can count on me, sir!

turns.speaker: MANAGER
turns.text: What are you doing? You don't ever criticize the feature!

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Why? What difference does it make? You already got his money...

turns.speaker: MANAGER
turns.text: Look, that's the policy... if you want to make up your own rules you can open your own theater...

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: But I was only trying to be friendly...

turns.speaker: MANAGER
turns.text: Look, we don't pay you to be a movie critic -- just do your job.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Okay, okay... I won't say a word...

turns.speaker: MANAGER
turns.text: What the hell is wrong with you?!

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: What? I'm just kidding around with the customers... It's my shtick!

turns.speaker: MANAGER
turns.text: Well lose it! And why aren't you pushing the large sizes? Didn't you get training about upsizing?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: But I feel weird... it's so sleazy.

turns.speaker: MANAGER
turns.text: It's not optional!

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Jesus...
